basics.label:
Software Engineering Manager
Generalist & Maker
basics.name: Nathan L. Sandland
basics.summary: **Software engineer and manager with 25 years of full stack software industry experience, half of which has been with Google.** I have a passion for product development, and a generalist mentality--working cross discipline to drive innovation. Currently managing a team of 15+ mobile engineers at Google Nest.

work.summary: Managed a 15+ person team of Android and iOS developers working on the Nest app and the Google Home App.
highlights: Device Setup in the Google Home App
Legacy Nest account migration to Google

work.position: Software Engineering Manager & Developer - Google for Kids
work.summary: Managed a 13+ person team building support for Kids & Families across Google.
highlights: Conceptualized and led app development of [Family Link](https://families.google.com/familylink/)
Taught a course in software development excellence, called 'Code Retreat'

work.position: Software Engineering Manager & Developer - Google TV
work.summary: Managed a 6+ person team building PrimeTime content discovery app for Google TV.
highlights: Brought PrimeTime app to initial launch and supported it for 2 years beyond that.
Invented and prototyped content search engine for Google TV.

work.summary: Led team responsible for building an LDAP-like employee database used to power Google's internal employee lookup tool, and various human resources apps.

highlights: Content Management System (CMS) for Novell marketing group

work.summary: Led a team to develop a portfolio management application for private equity fixed income portfolio managers.
Built tools for supporting good software engineering practices and code reuse.

education.studyType: Non-degree coursework in Machine Learning and Information Retrieval

volunteer.summary: Founded and mentored Vex IQ robotics team.
Mentored award winning FIRST robotics team.

volunteer.organization: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
